Hi All,

I wanted to tell you about a workshop Iâ€™ll be leading on Saturday, July 10 (the last one that I'll be leading before leaving for Oregon) that I think you'll enjoy and benefit from.

Many of you have told me that you wanted a better understanding of Neuro-Linguistic Programming (and how to use it) without enrolling in a 6-month certification program. Well, your wish has come true!
Here are the details:

What: Powerful Tools for Personal Change: An Intensive Introduction to NLP (Neuro-Linguistic Programming)
Date: Saturday, July 10, 2010
Time: 9:30am - 5:30pm
Place: First Parish UU Church in Brookline, 382 Walnut St, Brookline 02445
Tuition: $149 ($99 if paid by July 2)

In this one-day interactive and stimulating workshop, you will learn and practice the following key concepts:

- Rapport building: simple and effective ways to create and maintain connection with others
- Setting outcomes: powerful techniques for goal setting
- Behavioral flexibility / Anchoring: processes for enhancing your internal state, wherever/whenever you need it
- Sub-modalities: the underlying structure of our experience, and powerful tools to change those experiences
- NLP operating model: how NLP morphs from just a collection of techniques into a process for personal change
- Introduction to advanced NLP topics: get a sense of what else is possible with NLP
- Integration: putting it all together

By the end of the day, you will have both a useful framework for how to apply NLP, and tools to help yourself and others create personal change.

Other Details:

- Attendance is limited to 30, so if you are interested please register soon,
- Tuition is $149, but I'm offering a steep early bird discount ($99!) if you register by July 2.
- There are a limited number of scholarships and work-study positions available - please inquire if interested.

** Please forward this to anyone who might want to learn more about NLP. **

Feel free to email (adam@NewLightNLP.com) or call (617-329-1657) if you have questions about how this workshop would be useful for you.

All the Best,
Adam
